discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer is D. Clicking "check now" just looks for new updates. If you have a schedule set up the system is already looking for new updates on its own though. To see if an update will affect an existing rule, you have to download the update and then click on "review policies" to see impact the update will have (Answer D).

Answer is D
"Action > Download: Additionally, downloading an Application and Threat content release version enables the option to Review Policies that are affected by new application signatures included with the release."

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-0/pan-os-web-interface-help/device/device-dynamic-updates.html
Correct Answer: D

Selected Answer: D

- after download

D is correct

Very Tricky. Yes, "after the download" you must A. A is the last step you can take before choosing to Commit. You don't have an "A" until you "D" but "D" is not "A".

discussion.content:

Selected Answer: D
D make more sense to me.

Lists the versions that are currently available on the Palo Alto Networks Update Server. To check if a new software release is available from Palo Alto Networks, click Check Now. The firewall uses the service route to connect to the Update Server and checks for new content release versions and, if there are updates available, displays them at the top of the list.
Answer is A, I checked on the Firewall

questions.question_text: At which point in the App-ID update process can you determine if an existing policy rule is affected by an App-ID update?

choices.A: after clicking Check Now in the Dynamic Update window

questions.question_text:
You receive notification about a new malware that infects hosts. An infection results in the infected host attempting to contact a command-and-control server.
Which Security Profile detects and prevents this threat from establishing a command-and-control connection?

discussion.content: B is correct

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
B is correct: Anti-Spyware Security Profiles block spyware on compromised hosts from trying to communicate with external command-and-control (C2) servers, thus enabling you to detect malicious traffic leaving the network from infected clients.

choices.C: Antivirus Profile applied to outbound Security policy rules
choices.B: Anti-Spyware Profile applied to outbound security policies.
choices.D: Data Filtering Profile applied to outbound Security policy rules.
choices.A: Vulnerability Protection Profile applied to outbound Security policy rules.

questions.question_text: Which User-ID mapping method should be used for an environment with users that do not authenticate to Active Directory?

choices.B: passive server monitoring using the Windows-based agent
choices.D: passive server monitoring using a PAN-OS integrated User-ID agent

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Authentication portal -This method of user mapping is useful in environments where the firewall cannot learn mappings through other methods such as monitoring servers. For example, you might have users who are not logged in to your monitored domain servers, such as users on Linux clients.

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-0/pan-os-admin/user-id/map-ip-addresses-to-users

If you have users with client systems that aren’t logged in to your domain servers—for example, users running Linux clients that don’t log in to the domain—you can Map IP Addresses to Usernames Using Authentication Portal. Using Authentication Portal in conjunction with Authentication Policy also ensures that all users authenticate to access your most sensitive applications and data.
its Authentication portal in newer OS

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C

Selected Answer: C
C. Captive Portal

Selected Answer: C
C is Correct
C is Correct.

choices.C: When guided by an authorized sales engineer, it helps determine the areas of greatest risk where you should focus prevention activities.
choices.D: It provides a set of questionnaires that help uncover security risk prevention gaps across all areas of network and security architecture.
choices.B: It shows how current configuration compares to Palo Alto Networks recommendations.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true regarding a Best Practice Assessment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The attempt here is to determine competency in selecting between two Palo Tools: 
Prevention Posture Assessment (PPA)—The PPA is a set of questionnaires that help uncover security risk prevention gaps across all areas of network and security architecture.
Keep your mind straight and understand what is PPA or BPA.

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices/10-2/bpa-getting-started

First line: "The Best Practice Assessment (BPA) tool compares the configuration of firewalls and Panorama to the Palo Alto Networks best practice recommendations"

choices.B: Manually remove powerball.com from the gambling URL category.
choices.C: Add *.powerball.com to the URL Filtering allow list.
choices.D: Create a custom URL category, add *.powerball.com to it and allow it in the Security Profile.
choices.A: Add just the URL www.powerball.com to a Security policy allow rule.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Vague question. You cant "just" add url into security policy, you have to create fqdn object beforehand. C or D make more sense to me; D if I must choose one...

Selected Answer: A
Q51) The PowerBall Lottery has reached a high payout amount and a company has decided to help employee morale by allowing employees to check the number, but doesn't want to unblock the gambling URL category.

in Q111) it mentioned the lottery website itself (www.powerball.com)
Answer is A here..
Creo que es la D.

Selected Answer: CD
this is the same as question 51, just missing the "choose two" answers intthe instructions. Therfore, the two options that make sense and are consistent with question 51 would be C and D
A is not correct as you cannot add www.powerball.com to a security policy unless you first create an address object and add the fqdn. A does not mention doing any of this.

Selected Answer: A
As @OhEmGee said

Selected Answer: A
The question is about very specific URL, which can't be 'limited' by *.powerball.com as this would allow a.powerball.com, a.b.c.powerball.com etc.
in my opinion, only D is the correct answer

comments.content: why do you think the adding domain into url allow list is not useful? I think it's OK C and D are correct.

questions.question_text:
The PowerBall Lottery has reached an unusually high value this week. Your company has decided to raise morale by allowing employees to access the PowerBall
Lottery website (www.powerball.com) for just this week. However, the company does not want employees to access any other websites also listed in the URL filtering `gambling` category.
Which method allows the employees to access the PowerBall Lottery website but without unblocking access to the `gambling` URL category?
